729399f-c.title: Richmond: Richmond Road - Otis Avenue
729399f-c.text:
(1)
Richmond Road, east side, between Otis and Bryant
Avenues, showing the old Lockman-Taylor-Cortelyou House.
For additional information see other views.
By Mulford Simonson  About 1910
From P.L. Sperr Collection
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
The rear of the Lockman House, before it was rebuilt.
From P. L. Sperr Collection February, 1922
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(3)
The rear of the Lockman House, after rebuilding. Note
the dormer windows which were added on the second floor.
From P.L. Sperr Collection  August, 1923
NO REPRODUCTIONS
729399f-c.folder: Richmond Road & Otis Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729400f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Road - Otis Avenue
729400f-a.text:
(1)
Richmond Hoad, east side, between Otis and Bryant Avenues,
ahoWing the Lockman-Taylor-Cortelyou House, a colonial home.
Because of a burglary in this house, a negro suffered the first
legal execution in the county. In James Butler's 1853 map it
appears as the E. Taylor house; in Beers's 1874 map as Mrs. S.
Barton's house. Succeeding maps from 1887 to 1907 show it to be
on property belonging to O.J. Tysen. See ''History-Story-Legend
of the Old King's Highway'' by Staten Island Antiquarian society,
p. 14.
About 1900
Ry Eugene G. Putnam
From Staten Island Collection through P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
Another view of the Lockman-Taylor-Cortelyou House, at a
later date, showing structural changes.
1924
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(3)
An additional view of the house at a still later date,
showing further change.
May 26, 1937
729400f-a.folder: Richmond Road & Otis Avenue, Staten Island, NY
